Louis XIV (5 September 1638  1 September 1715), known as Louis the Great (
Louis le Grand) or the Sun King (le Roi-Soleil), was a monarch of the House of 
Bourbon who ruled as King of France from 1643 until his death in 1715. His reign 
of 72 years and 110 days is the longest of any monarch of a major .... In 1646 
Nicolas V de Villeroy became the young king's tutor.
